My family had a delightful time at Mindy and Ernieâ€™s cabin. The cabin is completely charming and very clean, and the surrounding property is so beautiful. We enjoyed hiking the trails every day. The screened in porch was perfect for eating dinner and having morning coffee. We could listen to the sounds of nature without having to endure insects at the same time. We had a great time playing cornhole, volleyball, and badminton with each other. The fire pit was fantastic in the evenings. We had everything we needed while we were there, plus we were happy to have the amenities of a beautiful bathroom and air conditioning!
Shortly after we arrived, Mindy drove up as we were outside playing cornhole. She wanted to make sure we had everything we needed and to let us know that we could text if there was anything at all that we needed. On the final morning we were there, my husband took a couple of our kids to the pond to fish. They asked Ernie if they were on the right track as they passed by, and he explained how to get there. A little while later, he rode down on a four wheeler to make sure they were heading in the right direction. Itâ€™s that kind of thing that helps add to the experience. We felt that Mindy and Ernie genuinely wanted us to feel at home and enjoy our time there. We are so grateful that they are willing to share their property and would highly recommend their cabin to anyone who wants to unplug and be close to nature, while still enjoying modern amenities! Our kids (12, 9, and 7) did not miss tv or wifi at all, and they have made us promise that we will go back again some day and stay longer next time. None of us were ready to leave! Thank you, Mindy and Ernie, for a wonderful getaway!

The property was amazing. The house itself was a bit dated (kind of like going back in time to the late 80s/early 90s), but everything in the home were in perfect working order. The kitchen was fully equipped and had a large refrigerator, microwave and stove. It was an open concept and made the living space on the first floor very open. The living room has a log stove which came in very useful - it was a treat to have a nice fire going when it was rainy outside. The bedrooms and bathrooms were well appointed including a jacuzzi tub in the Master. The only thing to remember is bath soap is not provided, so be sure to bring your own. The basement was a dream come true for our youngest son as he could watch tv, play games and play ping-pong as well. Movie night was always a big hit!
We had complete privacy (unless you count the cows) which was fantastic. While some hosts may claim privacy, you can find neighbors much closer than you expected. Here - the only person we saw was the caretaker Roger (and he was an absolute gem!) The nearest town was about 20 minutes away, so if you forget anything you do have a chance to grab it - just be aware you will be driving at least 40 minutes round trip. There is no internet access on the property as described, however when we needed it, we were able to use our phone hotspot....most of the time.
The outdoors was even better than the house! The lake was freshly stocked with fish (although most we caught were on the small side) and we were able to take the pontoon boat out around the lake to see turtles, deer, cows, various waterfowl and hawks. We were able to hike around the lake and even take our .22 long rifle to do some target shooting. The deck came with an outdoor firepit along with wood for guest use, which was an amazing touch by the host.
We were very excited to get here and even more impressed when we did. We would recommend this spot to anyone looking for a quiet get away and are looking forward to our next visit!

The only negative I would mention is having to drive a couple of miles on dirt/gravel roads to get to the property and it had rained. If you have AWD vehicle you will be fine.
